Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (fired reddish in places); band in added white at bottom; exterior: part of guilloche pattern above band; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 31 is written in pencil on the sherd's interior surface. The guilloche pattern in the handle zone is not specific to the Wild Goat Style but the thickness of the sherd and the lack of decoration on the interior surface do place it as early as 630-610BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0082) (phase 2)
